questionText: What are the different parts of a circuit, and how do they work together?
What is a switch? Why do some circuits need them, and how do they control electricity?
How do batteries help circuits work, and what happens when a battery dies?
What do you think would happen if a wire in a circuit was broken?
How do inductors and resistors work, and where might we see them in real life?
Why do we use circuit boards in computers and phones?
If you could design your own circuit for a machine, what would it do and how would it work?
Why are circuits important in our everyday lives?
What do circuits do inside electronic devices like phones or computers?
What are conductors and insulators, and why do we need both in a circuit? Can you think of any examples of either?
What do you think are characteristics of good conductors?
Why do you think some materials allow electricity to flow while others do not?
What happens if part of a circuit is broken?
If you were designing a smart home, how would you use circuits to make it more efficient?
Why do we use both conductors and insulators in circuits?
How do diodes help control the flow of electricity in a circuit?
What were the results of the creation of the circuit?
Why do some materials conduct electricity better than others?
How do capacitors help cameras, flashlights, and other devices work more efficiently?
